Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c It seems that combination of aPoW and prices creates some difficulties in mining and node sync. Currently I have 3 nodes i network, only one mining but other 2 nodes won't sync to current chain tip. Also, new blocks need too much time sometimes...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why wont it sync? that seems a bug

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what blocktime are you using?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe use a 5 minute blocktime?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I'm using regular blocktime - 1 min

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Now they are synced. I'll monitor it for a while. But definetely when I start daemons they need more time to synce than regular

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: And I also have strange node blocking. On one node where I don't mine, I do gatewayswithdraw and then sendrawtransaction and it hangs on send rpc

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Found the blocking reason, my bad didn't do unlock of critical section in gatewayswithdraw

Author: Mihailo#5902
Mihailo#5902
Content: I had period with 10 minutes no block

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But also, aPoW seems to run long until it even find block (without prices rejecting it).

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Who made aPoW? Can he checks out what is going on on EURKTEST as I don't have experience with aPoW.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any chain with DTO shouldnt have a blocktime faster than 5 minutes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can you see if the problem goes away with 5 minute blocks?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok, how do I set block time to 5 minutes? But block time of 5 minutes will be bad UX with gateways (deposit, claim, withdraw, signing will all last 5 times longer).

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Saw -ac_blocktime, but this will change magic calc?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I can run another chain without creating oracle, tokens, gateways. Just mine blocks to see how it behaves

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes ac_blocktime=300

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: will change magic

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: OK, I'll run another chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i thought you did parallel withdraws

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so from mempool it does it

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, sorry. It won't affect signing as it happens in mempool.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Let me check if it solves anything, then we'll think how to optimize it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Another bad thing with 5 minute block would be that for example if external chain is 1 minute block, a lot blocks can accumulate to be submitted in oracle before new block on AC so we'll have to make 10-15 subscribes per publisher in order to be able to submit all blocks and not be to behind external chain.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c Still same problem even with blocktime 300 (but it may be because chain didn't stabilize yet - blocks were pretty fast), no block for 24 minutes now.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: It seems it was working ok until aPoW kicked in...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so apow is not compatible for some reason with a prices chain? this will take a bit to fix. i guess for now skip the adaptivepow, good thing we found this issue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: keep that chain alive if you can. i will try to debug it next week

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but not sure if i will have the time, so best to skip it for this iteration

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Left it running, if you can just take a look what happens it would be good. I'll also check out when it stabilizes
